spiritsExplanation:
The workout 'Running Up the Hill Row' is classified primarily under the "High-Energy & Intense" spirit due to its description of having 'four phases of HIIT intervals,' with a maximum rhythm of 30. This indicates a fast-paced, high-intensity workout focused on pushing physical limits. The workout intensity level is 3 out of 3, reinforcing the vigorous nature. The 1980s and global hit music further support an energetic vibe.

It is also classified under "Outdoor & Adventure" since the image associated with the metadata shows an individual rowing on a river. Rowing in a natural outdoor setting aligns well with the adventurous spirit, embracing environmental challenges and exploration.

Other spirits like "Flow & Rhythm" are less applicable due to the emphasis on intervals and intensity over continuous flow and coordination. "Structured & Disciplined" could be somewhat relevant due to structured phases, but it is not the main focus.
